fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating inline tasks stopped working in Confluence v6.14.x. 

My app "Diary for Confluence" makes use of the comment editor and customers really like being able to use task lists. I already spent a few hours looking into the Confluence source code but I couldn't find any extra settings that I would need to pass to the editor or something like that to enable Task Lists again. For now, it's just broken.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a comment editor in a page
# Execute these commands in the console: {code}AJS.Meta.set('use-inline-tasks', 'true');
AJS.Rte.getEditor().execCommand('InsertInlineTaskList');{code}

h3. Expected Results
Inline Task gets inserted into the editor.

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens.

h3. Notes
* Works with v6.13.x
* Fails in v6.14.x and v6.15.x
* {{AJS.Rte.getEditor().execCommand('InsertUnorderedList');}} still works

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Inline tasks break with TinyMCE v4 (Confluence 6.14+)

fields.description: We are using confluence for company style guides and best practices. This includes several language specific guides. It would be nice if syntax highlighting was supported for more languages. In particular we have CMake and MATLAB guides that include code blocks with no syntax highlighting. There is currently an open issue for MATLAB (CONFSERVER-32150), so I'm adding one for CMake. This also relates to the much older issue CONFSERVER-1646, which is marked as resolved.
fields.summary: Support for {code:cmake} in the code macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The stdout.log is being flooded with Synchrony Healthcheck exceptions every 30 seconds.  They currently appear to be harmless.

They are not present in atlassian-confluence.log, atlassian-diagnostics.log or atlassian-synchrony.log

h3. Expected Results

The exception is not present.  

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the stdout.log file:

{noformat}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: No converter found for return value of type: class com.atlassian.synchrony.proxy.web.HealthCheckResult
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: stdout.log is flooded with Synchrony Healthcheck exceptions

fields.description:
1. Create a new Code Block Macro on some page and add a couple Python functions with blank lines between them (where the line is just a carriage return or line feed or both).

2. Save the page.

3. Copy the Python code out of the block on the page in a normal view.

4. The copied code has extra spaces (nbsp) on the blank lines. This causes issues when pasting into a Python interactive shell.
fields.summary: Code Block Macro Inserts Spaces on Blank Lines Breaking Python Code Copy/Paste into Shell

fields.description:
h3. Problem Summary

After disabling the Analytics plugin we have found that this doesn't disable the "Publish Daily Statistics" job and therefore the job creates many log warnings:

{code}
2019-04-25 04:00:00,044 WARN [Caesium-1-4] [impl.schedule.caesium.JobRunnerWrapper] runJob Scheduled job com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-periodic-analytics-events:confluenceDailyStatisticsPublisherJob#confluenceDailyStatisticsPublisherJob completed unsuccessfully with response JobRunnerResponse[runOutcome=ABORTED,message='Can't collect analytics.']
{code}

h3. Proposed Solution

Looking into this further we can see that the Periodic Event Publisher Job is returning the error when it can't get access to the getAnalyticsConfigService (which is com.atlassian.analytics.api.services.AnalyticsConfigService)

To clean up the logs, perhaps as a part of a sprint to remove erroneous log errors a feature can be added that if Analytics is disabled we do not log the warning or attempt to get access.

h3. Environment

Confluence 6.15.x
fields.summary: Disabling Analytics functionality creates log spam

fields.description:
Using Macro Browser, Users should see which company has created macros (and perhaps even from which plugin?).

Many macros supplied by 3rd-party companies have similar functionality as Confluence shipped macros as well as other companies but it is hard to determine which one to choose - especially if they are named the same.

I would like my users to be able to easily understand if they are using an Atlassian macro (and therefore probably supported more long-term) or another provider's macros.  They may decide to use the other macro if it has enhanced functionality - but I would like them to know the risk involved.

The thumbnails are nice, but not helpful to an end user.

 

Thanks!

Rick
fields.summary: Using Macro Browser in Confluence, Users should be able to see which company has created macros

fields.description:
As an administrator, I sometimes need to test functionality in environments aside from production. To do this, I can use a developer license, but for Data Center this requires infrastructure setup including a database. You cannot use a developer license on an H2 database, only a trial license per the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/embedded-h2-database-145098285.html].

Administrators would like to test non-DC functionality using the H2 database on a local machine, similar to how the trial licenses can be used with an H2 database.

As a workaround you can use a trial license from https://my.atlassian.com
fields.summary: Allow use of the H2 database by the Confluence developer license

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching for a word or a phrase is not working in _.docx_ files.
This seems to be a regression of Bug *[CONFSERVER-35322|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35322]*

h3. Steps to Reproduce

 # Setup Confluence 6.15.2 or 6.15.4
 # Attach *[this file|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/25807/Test.docx]* to any page
 # Wait for the index flush to run, or you can trigger it via *Confluence Admin > Scheduled* Jobs, or you can rebuild the index via *Confluence Admin > Content Indexing*
 # Search for "random string of words"

The file that was attached will not be listed in the search results.
h3. Notes

This issue is seen only on _.docx_ files. Contents in _.xlsx_ and _.pptx_ files are correctly displayed in the search.
h3. Workaround

Edit the _.docx_ file and save it as a _.doc_ (Word 97-2003) file, then reattach to Confluence. The search works correctly on _.doc_ files.
fields.summary: docx files are not indexed in Confluence 6.x

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Missing "A-Z" icon for sorting the pages alphabetically under Space Tools - Reorder Pages. 
 The icon should appear right after changing the order of the pages under parent page.
h3. Environment

Confluence Server 6.14.3, 6.15.1
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and few child-pages under it with different names
 # Go to Space Tools > Reorder Pages
 # Change the order of the child pages
 # No "A-Z" showing next to the parent page item as expected

h3. Expected Results

The icon A-Z should appear next to the parent page item after changing the orders of the child-pages
h3. Actual Results

The icon A-Z is not showing up next to the parent page, however an invisible link next to the parent page item is still clickable to sort pages alphabetically
h3. Workaround

Clicking on the right side, next to the parent page item sorts the pages alphabetically
fields.summary: Missing "A-Z" icon for sorting the pages alphabetically under Space Tools - Reorder Pages

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Monitoring usage of the database connection pool is an important task for a Confluence administrator.
As a Confluence administrator, I would like to get that information directly in the application without needing to rely on specific monitoring tools nor on DBA specific knowledge.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an admin page similar to Jira's database monitoring.
(i) More information on this page can be found in [Monitoring database connection usage|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/monitoring-database-connection-usage-938847726.html].
 
h3. Workaround 
_No workaround available._
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator I would like to monitor database connection pool from the application

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF table can grow quite large, and can cause startup to take a long time. A query is run during startup that may need to be run more than a thousand times, and the lack of an index on the UUID column causes the queries to run slowly if there are hundreds of thousands of rows in the table. Here's the query: {code:borderStyle=solid}SELECT "NAME","PLUGIN_CLONE","TEMPLATE_ID","ID","UUID","PLUGIN_MODULE_KEY" FROM "AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF" WHERE "UUID" = ?{code}

h3. Environment

Issue does not seem to be specific to a version of Confluence or database


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On an instance of Confluence with several hundred thousands of rows in the AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF table, time how long startup takes.
 # Add an index to the UUID column in the AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF table, and then time to see how long startup takes.

h3. Expected Results

Confluence should already have an index on this column

h3. Actual Results

There is no index on the column.


h3. Notes

After adding the index to the UUID column on an instance with over 500,000 rows, startup time went from about 20 minutes to about 3 minutes.

h3. Workaround

You can add a column to this table with the following SQL statement, for Oracle: {code:borderStyle=solid}CREATE INDEX uuid_idx ON AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF (UUID);{code}
fields.summary: The AO_54C900_C_TEMPLATE_REF table does not have an index on the UUID column

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer reports that recently they observe new and old groups not synchronizing their memberships, no change in configuration was done.
h3. Environment

In this specific case:
 Confluence 6.12.3
 SunOne LDAP server
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Debug enabled on Crowd class: {{com.atlassian.crowd}}

The following error can be observed in the logs at the end of the sync process. If a synchronization is attempted via UI, it shows as failed:
{code:java}
2019-06-21 09:10:25,680 DEBUG [Caesium-1-1] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations] syncGroupMembersForGroup adding [ 0 ] group members from group [ group1 ]
2019-06-21 09:10:25,681 DEBUG [Caesium-1-1] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DirectoryCacheImplUsingChangeOperations] syncGroupMembersForGroup synchronised [ 4 ] group members for group [ group1 ] in [ 2ms ]
2019-06-21 09:10:25,715 DEBUG [Caesium-1-1] [crowd.directory.ldap.SpringLdapTemplateWrapper] call Timed call for lookup with mapper on cn=group2,ou=groups,o=domain took 34ms
2019-06-21 09:10:25,716 INFO [Caesium-1-1] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory] synchroniseCache failed synchronisation complete for directory [ 111111 ] in [ 264584ms ]
2019-06-21 09:10:25,736 ERROR [Caesium-1-1] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] pollChanges Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 111111 ].
java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.naming.InvalidNameException: Invalid name: jdoe
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.RFC4519Directory$3.apply(RFC4519Directory.java:820)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.RFC4519Directory$3.apply(RFC4519Directory.java:813)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$8.transform(Iterators.java:799)
	at com.google.common.collect.TransformedIterator.next(TransformedIterator.java:48)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$5.next(Iterators.java:558)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.RFC4519DirectoryMembershipsIterable$2.apply(RFC4519DirectoryMembershipsIterable.java:79)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.RFC4519DirectoryMembershipsIterable$2.apply(RFC4519DirectoryMembershipsIterable.java:64)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$8.transform(Iterators.java:799)
	at com.google.common.collect.TransformedIterator.next(TransformedIterator.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseMemberships(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:169)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.ldap.cache.AbstractCacheRefresher.synchroniseAll(AbstractCacheRefresher.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingRemoteDirectory.synchroniseCache(DbCachingRemoteDirectory.java:978)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.DirectorySynchroniserImpl.synchronise(DirectorySynchroniserImpl.java:67)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller.pollChanges(DbCachingDirectoryPoller.java:45)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.manager.directory.monitor.poller.DirectoryPollerJobRunner.runJob(DirectoryPollerJobRunner.java:85)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.schedule.caesium.JobRunnerWrapper.doRunJob(JobRunnerWrapper.java:120)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.schedule.caesium.JobRunnerWrapper.lambda$runJob$0(JobRunnerWrapper.java:91)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.VCacheRequestContextManager.doInRequestContextInternal(VCacheRequestContextManager.java:87)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.vcache.VCacheRequestContextManager.doInRequestContext(VCacheRequestContextManager.java:71)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.impl.schedule.caesium.JobRunnerWrapper.runJob(JobRunnerWrapper.java:91)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.runJob(JobLauncher.java:134)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launchAndBuildResponse(JobLauncher.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.core.JobLauncher.launch(JobLauncher.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.launchJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:443)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeLocalJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:410)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService.executeQueuedJob(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:388)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:285)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.CaesiumSchedulerService$1.consume(CaesiumSchedulerService.java:282)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.executeNextJob(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:59)
	at com.atlassian.scheduler.caesium.impl.SchedulerQueueWorker.run(SchedulerQueueWorker.java:34)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: javax.naming.InvalidNameException: Invalid name: jdoe
	at javax.naming.ldap.Rfc2253Parser.doParse(Rfc2253Parser.java:111)
	at javax.naming.ldap.Rfc2253Parser.parseDn(Rfc2253Parser.java:70)
	at javax.naming.ldap.LdapName.parse(LdapName.java:785)
	at javax.naming.ldap.LdapName.<init>(LdapName.java:123)
	at com.atlassian.crowd.directory.RFC4519Directory$3.apply(RFC4519Directory.java:818)
	... 31 more
{code}
An LDIF export of that group2 (last to show up in the logs before error) would look like this:
{code:java}
# group2, groups, domain
dn: cn=group2,ou=groups,o=domain
description: a sample group
mail: group2@domain
objectclass: top
objectclass: groupOfUniqueNames
objectclass: groupOfNames
objectclass: mailGroup
objectclass: inetLocalMailRecipient
objectclass: inetMailGroup
objectclass: inetMailGroupManagement
objectclass: nsManagedMailList
uniquemember: jdoe
uniquemember: jsmith
uniquemember: asierra
uniquemember: bbrown
uniquemember: bblack
uniquemember: uid=jdoe,ou=people,o=domain
uniquemember: uid=jsmith,ou=people,o=domain
uniquemember: uid=asierra,ou=people,o=domain
uniquemember: uid=bbrown,ou=people,o=domain
uniquemember: uid=bblack,ou=people,o=domain
cn=group2
{code}
Other groups in the environment looked like this (and sync succesfully):
{code:java}
# group1, groups, domain
dn: cn=group1,ou=groups,o=domain
description: another sample group
mail: group1@domain
objectclass: top
objectclass: groupOfUniqueNames
objectclass: groupOfNames
objectclass: mailGroup
objectclass: inetLocalMailRecipient
objectclass: inetMailGroup
objectclass: inetMailGroupManagement
objectclass: nsManagedMailList
uniquemember: uid=jdoe,ou=people,o=domain
uniquemember: uid=jsmith,ou=people,o=domain
uniquemember: uid=bbrown,ou=people,o=domain
uniquemember: uid=bblack,ou=people,o=domain
cn=group1
{code}
h3. Expected Results
 * Synchronization to be proceed, skipping invalid users names
 * Group membership synchronization for that group to be skipped
 * Sync process to continue synch'ing other groups

h3. Actual Results
 * Sync process is interrupted with failure
 * Confusing message in log: {{synchroniseCache failed synchronisation complete for directory [ 111111 ]}}

h3. Workaround
 # Remove the users with the misformatted names ({{jdoe}}, {{instead of uid=jdoe,ou=people,o=domain}})
 # Try to sync again.
 Check if it fails again:
{code:java}
ERROR [Caesium-1-1] [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] pollChanges Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 111111 ].
{code}
And if another group is listed right before that error:
{code:java}
[crowd.directory.ldap.SpringLdapTemplateWrapper] call Timed call for lookup with mapper on cn=group2,ou=groups,o=domain took 34ms
{code}
Then fix it the same way on the LDAP server (removing the mal formatted usernames)
fields.summary: Synchronizing group memberships fail. Error: java.lang.RuntimeException: javax.naming.InvalidNameException: Invalid name: jdoe

fields.description:
Currently, versions in Jira only track the release date (without a time). When these flow to a Confluence calendar, they appear as all day events.

If Jira could track a release datetime instead, they could flow to the Confluence calendar with the time.

This would allow us to manage our versions exclusively in Jira and allow stakeholders to see scheduled release datetimes in a calendar.
fields.summary: Track time for release date in JIRA to flow to a Confluence Calendar

fields.description:
h5. Problem Definition
Confluence Mobile app does not support [Client Authentication Certificates|https://www.techopedia.com/definition/29760/client-authentication-certificate]
Client certificates are only compatible with the mobile web version of Confluence

h5. Suggested Solution
Allow Confluence Mobile App users to utilize client authentication pfx certificates downloaded and stored on mobile devices.
fields.summary: Introduce Client Certificate usage on Confluence Mobile app

fields.description:
From Confluence 6.13.x onward, the application accept the AdoptOpenJDK JVM.

If we attempt to install/run Confluence 6.13.x or above when using the OPENJ9 flavor, the application will crash with the following error in the UI and a stacktrace in the logs:

  !System_error.PNG|width=667,height=225!
{code:java}
2019-06-21 18:38:58,146 ERROR [http-nio-8134-exec-9] [springframework.web.context.ContextLoader] initWebApplicationContext Context initialization failed2019-06-21 18:38:58,146 ERROR [http-nio-8134-exec-9] [springframework.web.context.ContextLoader] initWebApplicationContext Context initialization failed -- referer: http://Confluence_base_URL:8134/setup/evallicense.action | url: /setup/setupembeddeddb-default.action | traceId: 003832a7ce09a048 | userName: anonymous | action: setupembeddeddb-defaultorg.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'platformInitializer' defined in URL [jar:file://atlassian-confluence-6.13.4/webapps/../confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence-6.13.4.jar!/monitoringContext.xml]: Invocation of init method failed; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'platformInitializerServer' defined in URL [jar:file://atlassian-confluence-6.13.4/webapps/../confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence-6.13.4.jar!/monitoringContext.xml]: Cannot resolve reference to bean 'javaMemoryMonitor' while setting constructor argument with key [4]; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.BeanCreationException: Error creating bean with name 'javaMemoryMonitor' defined in URL [jar:file://atlassian-confluence-6.13.4/webapps/../confluence/WEB-INF/lib/confluence-6.13.4.jar!/monitoringContext.xml]: Bean instantiation via constructor failed; nested exception is org.springframework.beans.BeanInstantiationException: Failed to instantiate [com.atlassian.confluence.internal.diagnostics.JavaMemoryMonitor]: Constructor threw exception; nested exception is java.lang.ClassCastException: com.ibm.lang.management.internal.ExtendedThreadMXBeanImpl incompatible with com.sun.management.ThreadMXBean at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.initializeBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:1631) at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.doCreateBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:553) at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.createBean(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:481) at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractBeanFactory$1.getObject(AbstractBeanFactory.java:312)

{code}
Based on the [supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf613/supported-platforms-964961686.html], there are no mentions of which flavor Confluence should support, therefore we must test with all provided or specify which one is supported.
h4. How to replicate

Install the AdoptOpenJDK with OPENJ9 flavor and set the JAVA_HOME system variable to use this version.
h4. Expected behavior

Confluence should run correctly with this JDK flavor.
h4. Workaround

Install the AdoptOpenJDK using the HOTSPOT flavor instead.

In case the Linux package installer does not provide the option to choose the flavor, it should be installed manually on the server and the JAVA_HOME variable changed to the new path.
fields.summary: Confluence fails to start/upgrade with AdoptOpenJDK when using OPENJ9 flavor

fields.description:
If a page has an internal link setup using a relative URL, then it will show up as Red in view mode if the link is broken.  Can we get that same functionality in the editor?  Right now broken relative links will still show as working within the editor.

We have a lot of pages that are translated to different languages in other spaces, and its hard to keep track of which links have already been updated in the newer translated space while editing the page.
fields.summary: Show broken links in the editor

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 29 July 2019|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5|titleBGColor=#3C78B5|titleColor=#FFFFFF|bgColor=#E7F4FA}
After some analysis we've found that this issue has been duplicated by the issue at [CONFSERVER-57949 - Changing the color of links in Confluence pages does not reflect on the links once the page is published| https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-57949]. This is a current and verified bug in Confluence, please watch that issue for further updates and more detailed workarounds.
{panel}
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to change colour of links in Confluence
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit page.
 # Add a link of another Confluence page by:
 ** Directly pasting a link of another Confluence page
 ** Go to Insert More Content > Link > Search > Insert for any other Confluence page
 # Highlight link.
 # Select red colour from "colour" menu in editor.
 # Update page.

h3. Expected Results

Link colour is changed to the desired red.
h3. Actual Results

Link colour is still blue.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
h3. Notes

This issue does not seem to affect external link, such as google.com
fields.summary: Unable to change colour of links in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We have a feature that saves a map of values in Bandana. Sometimes the error occurs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Save a map of values in Bandana

h3. Expected Results
Values should be saved successfully.

h3. Actual Results
A status 500 with the error below
{noformat}
.2019-06-04 03:58:19,136 ERROR [http-nio-7001-exec-26] [confluence.impl.vcache.SynchronousExternalCache] lambda$put$4 Failed to put entry into cache 'com.atlassian.bandana.BandanaPersister': Failed due to UNCLASSIFIED_FAILURE
{noformat}

h3. Notes
* Have not been experienced in server deployments
* So far, it can be intermittently hit in DC
* Can be replicated in versions 6.13.x
* Screenshot of what is being saved  !Screenshot 2019-06-20 at 09.44.15.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Saving value in bandana is intermittently throwing a status 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
PHP was removed from the list of languages (on [Code Block Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/doc/Code+Block+Macro]) for which we ship syntax highlighting, but in 6.15.3 I was able to confirm that PHP is in the dropdown. It appears PHP was removed from the documentation for 6.0.

 !image.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Solution
Add PHP to the list of languages the Code Block macro includes in our documentation.
fields.summary: Code Block Macro documentation should include PHP as a supported language
Companion App

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Confluence should provide a method to auto-check the option "Remember me" in the Login page, for selected clients only.
h3. Current behaviour

Currently, users have to check "Remember me" box in the Login page, and sometimes they miss it or it does not work in another way.

It is possible to set the default value to check, by [customising the Login page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/customizing-the-login-page-163938553.html] (changing the {{confluence/login.vm}} file), but that sets the auto-check for all clients, including clients on external computers.
h3. Desired behaviour

Providing a method to pass the option in the URL would allow to save it as a Bookmark, thus having the option already checked from the client side. For example {{http://<baseurl>/?rememberMe=true}} or {{http://<baseurl>/dologin.action?rememberMe=true}}
fields.summary: Method for clients to auto-check the option "Remember me" on the Login screen

fields.description: I indent text constantly and having to use the mouse to do so is very cumbersome. When in a content editing field, I would prefer that the "tab" and "shift+tab" keystrokes indent and remove indent respectively, since I do those thing much more frequently than switching focus between panes.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut to indent text

fields.description:
Majority occurrences of broken pipe log spamming is occurring when serving static files. An example of what this will look like can be found below:

{code:java}
2018-12-14 09:27:24,247 http-nio-8080-exec-18 ERROR anonymous 567x42x3 1ekan7f 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /s/d41d8cd98f00b204e9800998ecf8427e-T/-anlma9/76012/b6b48b2829824b869586ac216d119363/7aa44fa9aad9a6239c392b1e7bc884f4/_/download/contextbatch/js/browser-metrics-plugin.contrib,-_super,-atl.dashboard,-atl.general/batch.js [o.a.c.c.C.[.[.[.6.10].[file-server]] Servlet.service() for servlet [file-server] threw exception
java.lang.RuntimeException: org.apache.catalina.connector.ClientAbortException: java.io.IOException: Broken pipe
        at com.atlassian.plugin.cache.filecache.impl.StreamsCache.streamFromFile(StreamsCache.java:113)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.cache.filecache.impl.OneStreamCache.stream(OneStreamCache.java:54)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.cache.filecache.impl.FileCacheImpl.cache(FileCacheImpl.java:87)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.http.Controller.sendCachedInProduction(Controller.java:319)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.http.Controller.sendCached(Controller.java:282)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.http.Controller.serveResources(Controller.java:222)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.http.Controller.serveBatch(Controller.java:84)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.http.Router$5.apply(Router.java:78)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.http.Router$5.apply(Router.java:71)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.support.http.BaseRouter.callHandler(BaseRouter.java:169)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.impl.support.http.BaseRouter.dispatch(BaseRouter.java:144)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.webresource.servlet.PluginResourceDownload.serveFile(PluginResourceDownload.java:65)
        at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.AbstractFileServerServlet.doGet(AbstractFileServerServlet.java:28)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:635)
        at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:742)
        ... 44 filtered
{code}

The purpose of this feature request is to track the progress on suppressing these entries entirely from logging.
fields.summary: Suppress Excessive java.io.IOException: Broken pipe ERROR when serving static files

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira has an admin page to view global user sessions as detailed in [Monitor a user's activity|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/monitor-a-user-s-activity-828787672.html].
It would be interesting to have something similar on Confluence too.
As listed in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/monitor-a-user-s-activity-828787672.html], benefits are:
{quote}
 * Know who to contact before planned downtime.
 * Regularly monitor the average number of active users to evaluating your licensing quota.
 * View user count if the system is under duress.
 * And more!
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement on Confluence an admin page similar to the _Current User Sessions in JIRA_ ({{/secure/admin/CurrentUsersList.jspa}}).
 
h3. Workaround 
_There's no workaround so far_
fields.summary: As a Confluence administrator I would like to have an admin page to view global user sessions

fields.description:
This request is to add a feature to the Health Check to check if the version of Confluence is affected by a security breach based on public security advisories.

For example, on March and April 2019, we had 2 security advisories which impacted all versions of Confluence. As soon as they were made public, the health check should add a warning/banner to the admin section of Confluence (any Confluence admin will see it), showing a link to the advisory and warning that they should upgrade Confluence.

This will implement the notifications sent to Main technical Contacts and users subscribed under Tech Alerts
fields.summary: The health check should verify if the instance is running a vulnerable version based on our public security advisories

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence fails when attempting a PDF space export which is larger than 2GB. If the PDF gets larger than 2GB, the exception below is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2019-05-28 10:56:55,254 ERROR [Long running task: PDF Space Export] [core.task.longrunning.AbstractLongRunningTask] doInTransactionWithoutResult Error during PDF export
 -- url: /spaces/flyingpdf/doflyingpdf.action | referer: https://baseurl/spaces/flyingpdf/flyingpdf.action?key=FTS | traceId: df54d5bdae3red4e48 | userName: admin | action: doflyingpdf
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Size exceeds Integer.MAX_VALUE
{noformat}
There is an error in the GUI, but is not clear why the error is occurring:
 !2Gb PDF Space Export Limitation.png|thumbnail!

This is caused by a 2GB limit for PDF exports, due to the libraries utilized.
 * [Flying Saucer|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flying_Saucer_(library)] v9.1.6 library is used to render XHTML in memory for a space/page export.
 * Flying Saucer uses [iText|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IText] v2.1.7 library to export the rendered contents into a PDF file.
 * The iText library prior version 5.3 has the [limitation of 2GB|https://itextpdf.com/en/resources/faq/technical-support/itext-5-legacy/what-size-limit-pdf-file] for generated files.
 * This limitation exists due to {{java.nio.channels.FileChannel}} [limit of 2GB|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-6347833] for memory mapped files.

h3. Suggested Solution

One or more of the following options:
 * Improve the error message, which indicates the 2GB limit and update Confluence documentation to reflect the 2GB Limit.
 * Update Confluence to use a version of FlyingSaucer/iText that doesn't have the 2GB limit.
 * Update Confluence to export/compose the PDF to the file system and not directly to memory.

h3. Workarounds

Split the larger spaces into smaller spaces.

Additionally, we have tested a third party app that works with larger exports. Consider trying [Content Exporter (Word, PDF, HTML)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/4909/content-exporter-word-pdf-html] if you require a single PDF that will be larger than 2GB.
fields.summary: Allow PDF exports to be larger than 2GB

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary h3. Environment Confluence 6.15.5, pages saved in earlier versions of Confluence with broken emoticons ("broken" as per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-52441) h3. Steps to Reproduce # Have a page with a "broken" emoticon (saved in storage format as an "") which has a dash in the name (e.g. "thumbs-up", "thumbs-down", "green-star", "red-star", "yellow-star", "blue-star", "light-off", "light-on", "broken-heart") # Upgrade to 6.15.5 h3. Expected Results The emoticons are restored, can be viewed correctly on the view page and are correctly saved on next save.  h3. Actual Results The emoticons are incorrectly converted to HipChat emoticons (which are "unknown").   h3. Workaround Disable the "Confluence HipChat Emoticons Plugin" # Go to  !http://extranet.atlassian.com/download/thumbnails/4168188072/cog_icon.png?version=1&modificationDate=1560916171530&api=v2|width=16!  > *Manage apps* # Search for *Confluence Hipchat Emoticons Plugin.* This is a bundled plugin, so make sure the *All apps* option is selected in dropdown. # Click on the name of the plugin, then select *Disable*. !manage-apps-disable-hipchat-emoticons.png|width=468,height=407!   Alternatively, the fixed version of the  "Confluence HipChat Emoticons Plugin" can be installed in your 6.15.5 instance # Go to  !http://extranet.atlassian.com/download/thumbnails/4168188072/cog_icon.png?version=1&modificationDate=1560916171530&api=v2|width=16!  > *Manage apps* # Press "Upload app" # Upload the fixed version of the plugin attached to this ticket [^confluence-hipchat-emoticons-plugin-3.1.3.obr]
fields.summary: Emoticons with dashes are not correctly restored in 6.15.5

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Deleting an attachment causes comments referencing that attachment to show "unknown-attachment". It should instead show a more user-friendly message.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a comment to a page and attach a file in the comment. This will add the attachment to the page and the comment will reference the file.
 # While viewing the page go to "..." > Attachments, and remove the attachment

h3. Expected Results
Attachment shows a user-friendly message that lets the viewer know the file referenced is no longer attached to the page, e.g. "The attachment has been removed from this page"

h3. Actual Results
Attachment shows a "*? Unknown Attachment*" block in grey

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Deleting an attachment causes comments referencing that attachment to show "unknown-attachment"

fields.description:
Through Confluence version 6.13, requests for attachments by the Attachments macro were facilitated through a server side GET request.

However, since version 6.14, this functionality with the Attachments macro changed such that attachments are now retrieved via a series of client side POST requests that follow this format:
 * [http://localhost:8090/rest/files/1.0/files/content/1409025/byAttachmentIds]

For a given page that includes a large number of attachments, this large number of asynchronous POST requests can appear as a DDOS attack by web application firewalls.

Would it be possible to revert back to using the GET or coalesce these POST requests into one request for all attachments, rather than issuing them one per each attachment?

Otherwise, the only workarounds for this issue would be to either:
 * Reduce the number of attachments on a page.
 * Modify the firewall rules to allow a higher number of POST requests.
fields.summary: Reduce the number of POST requests when retrieving attachments via the Attachments macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a side effect of allowing anonymous access to Confluence, the REST API leaks information such as group names. If your organisation uses this information for verification or authentication in other areas then this information could be used to compromise or attack. There may also be information contained in group names that would violate the GDPR regulations by making it freely available.

h3. Environment

Any Confluence instance that is has anonymous access allowed at some level. There are some online examples below:

https://wiki.akraino.org/rest/prototype/1/search/user-or-group.json?max-results=50&query=a
https://confluence.atlassian.com/rest/prototype/1/search/user-or-group.json?max-results=50&query=a

h3. Suggested behaviour

The ability to prevent this information from leaking when anonymous access is enabled. There are some external infrastructure changes that could be made to prevent this access, but it is not always a given that this could be implemented in the instance concerned. This should be part of Confluence's default settings.
fields.summary: Confluence leaks group names when anonymous access is enabled
Download All Attachments of a page does not provide UI feedback about current status

fields.description:
h4. Problem description 
When viewing a page that contains the "Expand" macro, the "v"-icon of the expanded view seems to be placed too low compared to the text right next to it. When the macro is collapsed, the ">"-icon seems to be aligned properly (although maybe not pixel-perfect).

When looking at the sidebar, the "v"-icon of expanded parent pages, seems to be aligned properly whereas the ">"-icon of collapsed parent pages seems to be placed too high compared to the text.

On the "Reorder Pages"-screen it's the other way around again, "v"-icons are placed too low, ">"-icons seem to be ok.
h4. Environment
Tested with Internet Explorer 11, Firefox and Chrome with the zoom level set to 100%.
h4. Expected behavior
The icons should align properly, i. e. the tips of the icons should always be positioned at half-height of their associated texts, regardless of whether they are expanded or collapsed.
h4. Actual behavior
Using IE11, it's possible to highlight not only the text but also the icons by pressing Ctrl+A. This shows that the icons are never centered but rather stick to either the top or the bottom border of their associated texts.

Please see the attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Horizontal alignment of expand/collapse-icons and their associated texts is offset

fields.description:
How do I remove the author's name/etc from a Confluence page? My Confluence instance is server-based. 

Using the following link :: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-hide-content-author-name-created-by-in-a-page-701600769.html |https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-hide-content-author-name-created-by-in-a-page-701600769.html]:: does not seem work.

Also, the Stylesheet I see is titled "PDF Stylesheet", different from the label in the documentation.
fields.summary: Hiding "Authored by" and "Created by" in Confluence pages

fields.description:
h4. Problem Statement
The 'New expanded search' result is not prioritizing the *Page title* as it used to in previous 'Quick Search'.

h4. How 'Old Quick Search' gives results:
This search gives a result based on the following:
* title + boosting by recency + space preference

h4. How 'New Expanded Search' gives results:
This search gives a result based on the following:
* title (less sophisticated) + content body (number of matches of the word in the content) + boosting by recency

h4. Improvement
* Page title should still be the priority instead of less sophisticated, followed by the content body matches and recency.
fields.summary: The 'New expanded search' result is not prioritizing the *Page title* as it used to in previous 'Quick Search'.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Back button in browser navigation does not let user return to the editor.
h3. Environment

* slow edit only, not quick edit
 * editor-v4 (6.14.0+)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open page or blog post editor in a new tab (to make sure we're using slow-edit)
 # Click Preview button in the bottom right toolbar
 # Click Back button in the browser navigation bar

h3. Expected Results

Returning to editor
h3. Actual Results

Going back to the page before the editor, e.g. blank page if you started in a new tab.

Alternatively, the Back button may be disabled in case the editor was open in a new tab.
h3. Notes

(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

* Use quick-edit (clicking the Edit button in view page).

* Use the bottom right buttons in the Preview to return to the editor.
fields.summary: Browser Back button not working in Preview

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to edit an attachment with the Companion App (Confluence 6.11+) while Confluence is using SAML authentication, we receive an error message even though the file works fine in the appropriate editor.
h4. Steps to reproduce
 # Install Confluence 6.11.1 + Companion App;
 # Attach a Word document to a Confluence page;
 # Click on the Excel document to show in Preview;
 # Click on the *Edit with Word*;
 ** Word opens the document fine (/)
 # Now, integrate Confluence with an IdP (or Crowd SSO 2.0) using the [Atlassian SAML SSO app|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216096/sso-for-atlassian-server-and-data-center?hosting=server&tab=overview];
 ** Repeat the above test by clicking on the *Edit with Word;*

h3. Expected Result

Clicking the *Edit with <App>* should work with Confluence regardless whether Confluence is integrated with SSO.

h3. Actual Result

The system throws a popup message saying "File is corrupted and cannot be opened".

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Workaround

Disable the SAML plugin or edit the file directly in Word (or the respective app).
fields.summary: Companion App does not work when Confluence has the Atlassian SAML SSO app configured

fields.description:
Request that Confluence be architected to use asynchronous logging for enhanced performance. 

Currently Confluence 6.x uses Log4j-1 which has AsyncAppender, however we are not programmatically implementing this feature. 

[Log4j-2|https://logging.apache.org/log4j/2.x/] supports asynchronous logging (see the "Improved Performance section), requesting that Log4j-2 or above be considered to be used in future versions of Confluence and Confluence implement this functionality.
fields.summary: Confluence asynchronous logging

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When copying or moving page with attachment, the system setting "Attachment Maximum Size" does not apply. 

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.13.4 / 6.2.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page and add an attachment file with a size of 1 MB.
# Save the page. 
# Change the setting "Attachment Maximum Size" to 1 KB. 
# Copy / move the page created above to a new location.

h3. Expected Results
There might be a warning message on the attachment size with the page exceeded the limit or preventing the attachment from copying / moving over.

h3. Actual Results
The page can be copied/moved normally.

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Attachment Maximum Size does not apply when copying or moving page with attachment

fields.description: It is often impossible to use xml backup when switching database vendor for the Confluence (for Example from Oracle to Postgres). In that case the only option is to use  one of the external tools for example https://wiki.postgresql.org/wiki/Oracle_to_Postgres_Conversion however it would nice to have official documentation describing the migration process.
fields.summary: Provide documentation for oracle-postgres database migration process

fields.description:
h3. Environment
Confluence with WebDAV integration.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform the steps in [Configuring a WebDAV client for Confluence|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/configuring-a-webdav-client-for-confluence-148044.html#ConfiguringaWebDAVclientforConfluence-AccessingConfluenceinFinderonMacOSX] and access Confluence page via WebDAV.
(i) Tested with *Accessing Confluence in Finder on Mac OSX*.
# Navigate to the *@exports* Folder of a Page.

h3. Expected Results
PDF Files generated with content of the page.

h3. Actual Results
Empty PDF Files generated with 1 byte size:
* !emptypdf.png|thumbnail!
 
The following ERROR appear in the logs:
{code}
2019-06-14 14:40:08,485 ERROR [http-nio-8090-exec-8] [extra.webdav.resource.PagePdfExportContentResourceImpl] getContentInternal Error exporting page: This is Page to export v.1 (1638405) as PDF. Returning InputStream with one byte
 -- url: /plugins/servlet/confluence/default/Global/EW/Export%20Word%20Home/This%20is%20Page%20to%20export/@exports/ | traceId: 9ab70256bf5a3710 | userName: admin
java.lang.NoSuchMethodException: com.atlassian.confluence.extra.flyingpdf.DelegatingPdfExporterService.createPdfForPage(com.atlassian.user.User, com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Page, java.lang.String)
	at java.lang.Class.getMethod(Class.java:1786)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.resource.PagePdfExportContentResourceImpl.generatePdfExportFromPdfExporterService(PagePdfExportContentResourceImpl.java:81)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.resource.PagePdfExportContentResourceImpl.getContentInternal(PagePdfExportContentResourceImpl.java:122)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.resource.AbstractPageExportContentResource.checkWriteToTempFile(AbstractPageExportContentResource.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.resource.AbstractPageExportContentResource.getContentLength(AbstractPageExportContentResource.java:92)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.resource.AbstractContentResource.initProperties(AbstractContentResource.java:80)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.extra.webdav.resource.AbstractConfluenceResource.getProperties(AbstractConfluenceResource.java:163)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.MultiStatusResponse.<init>(MultiStatusResponse.java:180)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.MultiStatus.addResourceProperties(MultiStatus.java:62)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.MultiStatus.addResourceProperties(MultiStatus.java:66)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.server.AbstractWebdavServlet.doPropFind(AbstractWebdavServlet.java:434)
	at org.apache.jackrabbit.webdav.server.AbstractWebdavServlet.execute(AbstractWebdavServlet.java:231)
{code}

h3. Workaround
No Workaround at the moment.

h3. Notes
This issue does not affect the PDF files generated when you export the page directly from Confluence.
fields.summary: The PDF files in WebDAV @exports appear to be a 1 byte file with no content.

fields.description:
It seems that current Confluence implementation is pageId as "only number".  If user access Confluence with non-existing number such like a 9999999,  "Page Not Found" is displayed.  But if user access with pageId=999999test, user gets java.lang.NumberFormat.Exception.
It is nice to implement URL sanitary function for such case which shows "Page Not Found" error for user in such case.
fields.summary: User gets system error when accessing Confluence with pageId=999999test

fields.description:
Needs discussion on the security implications and solution (CORS, etc) however there is some interest in supporting cross origin requests to the Confluence REST API.

Original request: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31192
fields.summary: REST API Cross Domain Access Support

fields.description: Not until it's ready, of course.
fields.summary: Remove experimental status of Content Restrictions API

fields.description: Currently there is no service in confluence api to access trashed content to display the content in notification emails
fields.summary: Implement REST API to access trashed content

fields.description:
Derived from CONFDEV-24631 and some PR comments, not all Maps should be converted to EnrichableMap when deserialized from JSON.

Opting in can be done with the @JsonDeserialize(as=EnrichableMap.class) annotation, but there's a catch.

A spike of implementing this shows that it breaks Content+Space roundtrip unit tests that can't get the EnrichedMapDeserializer from the SerializerModule because it's in conf-rest-serialization module while the unit tests are in conf-java-api.

If we move all of the roundtrip tests to the rest module, we should be able to keep the java-api test code very lean.
fields.summary: Make EnrichableMap deserialization opt-in
Publish cql under /rest/api/content/search

fields.description:
(This issue has morphed from the original description of "trash a piece of content" because it's impossible to write one resource/service correctly, the first time, in isolation from other operations in the same context).

Basically: spike the basic shape of the [trash spec|https://pug.jira.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=949944417] to get good REST URIs, service interfaces/methods, and useful model objects.


_Was_:

Per the [trash spec|https://pug.jira.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=949944417] we'll be viewing the trashing of content as a state change rather than a location change.

To this end, it should be possible to trash a piece of content (that _can_ be trashed) by updating it via a PUT to have a status of TRASHED. The contents of the PUT should not include any other changes to the content.
fields.summary: Spike Trash
API: Authentication

getSpaces
getLabelsById
addLabelByObject
addAttachment
getComment
removePage
getAttachments
logout

fields.description:
Confluence has had [persistence|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Persistence+in+Confluence] for long long time.

For Conntect Add-on vendors is very important to keep as much information in Confluence as possible.

So all we need is to expose access to at least Content Properties.

It's a safe bet as the access is strictly associated to pages to which the user has permissions.

h3. References
*  https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Persistence+in+Confluence
* https://docs.atlassian.com/atlassian-confluence/latest/com/atlassian/confluence/core/ContentPropertyManager.html
fields.summary: REST access to Content Properties

It would be amazing to have required fields so that when anyone creates a ticket they have to put in the information. This in conjunction with the field descriptions would lead to more valuable tickets.
fields.summary: Required fields

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Include an option in the Companion App dialogue that links to an article for troubleshooting the Companion App if it's already been installed but it's not working or being detected by the browser

h3. Suggested Solution
Include a link on the Companion App download dialog that links to the Server Documentation:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/administering-the-atlassian-companion-app-958456281.html

h3. Why this is important
This could help both Users and Admin troubleshoot issues with the Companion App (like a Proxy Configuration)
 
h3. Workaround 
none
fields.summary: Add Link for Troubleshooting the Companion App in its Popup Dialogue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a profile is set to the Finnish language, adding calendar as a list view will result in month names overlapping over the event title.

h3. Environment
 * Profile Language is set to Finnish

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a calendar to a Confluence page and switch to *List* view
 # Switch language to Finnish

h3. Expected Results
Month names are shortened like in every other language not to overlap with the event title

h3. Actual Results
Month names are displayed in full:
 !short cal.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding a calendar as List view will result in overlapping month names in Finnish

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, on startup the Companion App will remove all attachments from its temporary directory. This is to prevent temporary files building up and taking up too much space. 

However, some users would prefer to have more control over when these files are deleted. We could provide a configuration option in the Companion menu such as "Clear temporary files on startup" that defaults to selected. If the user unticks this option then we would no longer perform the clear out of the temporary directory. 
h3.  

This suggestion is important in cases when the user did not upload changes, but it has saved them. And because of that, his changes will be gone, and we will not be able to recover them.
fields.summary: Companion App should provide a configuration option to prevent clearing files on startup

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, under User Management, Confluence shows directory information (name, created date and etc.) for the user. However, this information is missing for the user group.

h3. Suggested Solution
Show the information similar to the user for user groups under User Management.
fields.summary: Show directory information for user group under User Management

fields.description:
.h3. Issue Summary

When searching as an anonymous user, calendars are not included in the results
h3. Environment

Tested in:
 * Confluence 6.15.4
 * Team Calendars 6.0.27

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable anonymous access to your Confluence instance
 # Create a page with a calendar in it
 # Ensure that the space and page are accessible to anonymous users
 # Log out and access confluence as an anonymous user
 # Click the search field in the top right
 # Either filter by calendar and search for *, or search for your calendar by name

h3. Expected Results

The calendar appears in the results
h3. Actual Results

The calendar does not appear in the results
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Searching as an anonymous user doesn't return calendars

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Working on Large tables (more than 20 columns/rows), or, so large that can't fit in the current window, if changes conflicts with another user changes, during merge operation scroll bars are either not working (when you drag them the table cells to that direction are not shown) or they are missing.

h3. Notes
Collaborative Editing is disabled
Test was done on a single Server
[documentation reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/concurrent-editing-and-merging-changes-144719.html]

h3. Environment
Checked on Confluence Server 6.6.7 and 6.13.1
Tested on IE, Chrome and Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Created the page with a large table
# Caused an editing merge conflict, as the one in your screenshot
# Was able to navigate both panels, for my changes and the ones done by the other user

h3. Expected Results
If the table goes beyond the visible area in the screen, you should have scrollbars to navigate horizontally or vertically

h3. Actual Results
# I see the horizontal scroll bar, but it does not navigate correctly
# And I don't see a vertical scroll bar
 !Screen Shot 2019-06-12 at 18.23.23.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Mouse with scroll button and trackpads can be used to navigate properly
fields.summary: Merging Edit changes in a Page with Large Tables missing or failing scrollbars

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Adding Jira Issue Macros to Confluence pages can sometimes result in the macro being placed in unexpected locations

h3. Environment
* Confluence connected to Jira via app link

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add a table to Confluence (3 rows or 4 with a header, 2 columns)
# Add a Jira Issue Macro for a single issue to the first row and first column
# Click in the third row and first column to place your cursor
# Use the + to add a Jira Issue Macro for a single issue

h3. Expected Results
The macro is placed at the current cursor location

h3. Actual Results
The macro is placed in the first row/column, as shown below:
 !JIM-Table-Bug.gif|thumbnail! 

 
h3. Notes
It seems that this only affects macros added via the + option in the Confluence editor toolbar. Pasting a link to a Jira issue always seems to work, and placing a macro via '{' seems to work (I could not replicate using that test).

h3. Workaround
* Copy and paste the URL of Jira Issues
* Use the '{' keyboard shortcut to place a Jira Issue macro instead of the + option in the toolbar
fields.summary: Jira Issue Macros added to Confluence are always placed at the cursor location

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing the .properties file of a plugin to customize text as described in [How to edit bundled or system plugins|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-edit-bundled-or-system-plugins-302811979.html], the customized text does not display.
h3. Environment

Confluence 6.10 and above
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Stop Confluence
 # Edit the text in the .properties file within a plugin's .jar file as described in [How to edit files in Confluence JAR files|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-edit-files-in-confluence-jar-files-103711179.html]
 # [Clear the Plugin Cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-clear-confluence-plugins-cache-297664846.html]
 # Clear Browser's cache
 # Restart Confluence

h3. Expected Results

Edit the appropriate text for key entries in the {{.properties}} file, see the change in the web UI.
h3. Actual Results

The default text of the key is still shown, the customized text is not.
h3. Notes

This works in Confluence 6.9 and below.
h3. Workaround

This issue can be circumvented by creating a new key in the .properties file and then changing references elsewhere in the plugin to use this key instead of the default key. 
 # Stop Confluence
 # Make a backup copy of the original .jar file
 # Expand the contents of the .jar file
 # Locate the text value you wish to change in the .properties file, notate the name of this key
 # Create a new key with a similar name, adding a ".custom" to the key's name and customize the text
 # Search the contents of the files expanded from the .jar for the original key's name
 # Replace each reference found to the new key name in each of these files, save
 # Recompress the .jar file together with these edited files
 # Copy the customized .jar file back to its original location, overwriting the original
 # [Clear the Plugin Cache|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-clear-confluence-plugins-cache-297664846.html]
 # Clear Browser's cache 
 # Restart Confluence
fields.summary: Customizing text in the .properties file of a Plugin .jar file results in the default text being shown

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
# The color scheme *Search Field Text* only applies to the text we type into the search box in Confluence, and the magnifier icon, and not the *Search* text we see in the search box before we type in anything.
# It would be better if the color scheme also applies to the *Search* text, for a more consistent look and feel.

Related: CONFSERVER-58418
fields.summary: Color scheme for "Search" text

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
# Confluence has the color scheme option for *Search Field Text*, which colors the text we input into the search box on the top right of Confluence.
# Starting Confluence 6.14 however, as soon as we click on the search box, a pop up search appears, and there's no option to change the color of this search field text.
** [Confluence 6.14 Search|https://confluence.atlassian.com/conf614/search-965546013.html]
# It would be better to have the *Search Field Text* to change the color of the text for the new search instead.
fields.summary: Apply color scheme value for Search Field Text onto new Search UI.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition  

* Currently, it is only possible to change the PDF Export language font to the whole Confluence instance, but it might be useful for some use cases to have the PDF Export language font more user-centered, allowing each user to have one specific to their use.

h3. Suggested Solution 

* Have an option to change the PDF Export language font for one user only, not to the whole instance

h3. Why this is important   

* In teams that work with multiple languages, it might be helpful to have this feature set individually, allowing each person to have its own set of language and font, depending on their needs.

h3. Workaround 
N/A
fields.summary: Allow the PDF Export Language Font to be set by each user's account

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Pressing TAB in a table is not able to navigate to the next cell in IE

h3. Environment
Confluence 6.15.2
Internet Explorer version: 11.503.17763.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Browse Confluence with IE11
# Create a page and add in table with multiple rows and columns (eg: 3x3)
# Click on any of the cell in the table
# Press TAB for navigating to the next cell

h3. Expected Results
The cursor will switch to the cell on the right or create a new row if it is located on the bottom right cell

h3. Actual Results
The cursor did not move

h3. Information
The navigating behavior was not the same in the earlier release of Confluence(or Internet Explorer) based on the bug reports below:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-37474
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-54294

h3. Workaround
# Use a different browser such as Chrome, Firefox or Edge
# Manually change to different cell by clicking
fields.summary: Pressing TAB in a table is not able to navigate to the next cell in IE

fields.description:
The code block macro optionally provides line numbering. Which can be a helpful feature, if you want to refer to specific code lines from within the text around the code block.

But when editing the page text you don't see the code numbers. Which makes it quite difficult and uncormfortable to refer to code lines by code number. 

Thus I'd like to see the line numbers as well in edit mode, at least optionally.
fields.summary: Display code block line numbers in editor, too

fields.description: It would be a great feature to have Confluence allows a specific set of people belonging to a group have Collaborative Editing privileges or have Collaborative Editing option available for specific Space/s
fields.summary: Enabling Collaborative Editing for a specific Space/s
